page.title: 18A Day In My Life
page.content: My name is Helen Huddart. I am ten years old. I live with my parents and two sisters Claire 13 and Alison 4 in Boothstown. My mum woke me at 7.30am and I had breakfast at 8 o'clock. On the way to school I stopped at the sweet shop with my friends. School started at 8.55am and after assembly I went to my maths group. After I had finished my maths I tried out a new computer program called 'Surburban Fox'. At playtime I practised dancing in the yard with my friends. After play I drew a picture of our trip to the Mines Rescue Station. At lunchtime I ate some ham sandwiches and a piece of cake. Afterwards I just sat outside on the grass. At 1 o'clock I went back into school and soon it was time for the baths. We went by bus to Eccles Pool.
